Review.Titre: At 3:22 p.m
Review.Contenu: At 3:22 p.m. on December 8, 2023, I contacted TNT, (877 287 5256) because I was interested in purchasing an internet plan, applying a school discount. I spoke with the advisor Jose Perez, he told me about the promotion and assured me that I would pay a maximum of 15.00 per month. He informed me that I should contact Earthlink today, December 9, for said discount (866 383 3080). At 11:47 am I talk to Sara and she tells me that it is another value. That they do not apply a school discount. For me it is super annoying to hear that I had to pay almost 60.00 monthly. That is to say, they changed all my information. It is a lack of respect for the client and the trust that one expects to be correct. Reason why I decide to cancel the plan. I hope for a refund and that they take action in this situation.

I am very glad that I didn't sign up with Allconnect thinking that I was getting 50 when the company doesn't even offer it in my area. Don't trust Allconnect for sure.

Would not deal with Allconnect again!!!

Review.Titre: Do NOT use this company!
Review.Contenu: This company was awful to work with.  I called to set up internet with Xfinity and they Allconnect ended up setting me up with Breezeline internet and I was not informed until after the order was processed.  I had to call back to try to cancel the order because I was informed to cancel through Breezeline, but Breezeline didn't end up even having any of my information on file.  I had to call Allconnect back 5 different times and spent over 2 hours trying to fix the order that they placed through a company that I didn't want. The 5 times I called to cancel the order, Allconnect representatives hung up on me and transferred me to several other companies' customer service line that I have never even heard of.  The said they weren't able to cancel the order and could not help me on the last call that I placed.  Please DO NOT use this company ever for your cable or internet needs!  Allconnect is a 3rd party company, go directly to the actual company to set up service!  Allconnect will give you the run around and does not care if you are getting what you want to order as long as they can make the sale.

Review.Titre: Stay away from Allconnect
Review.Contenu: Thought I was calling T-Mobile spoke with Amelia (844-451-2720) and was given all wrong info. Install would cost $149 (not true no install necessary), router $15 a month to rent or I could purchase for $200 (not true no router needed), price per month if $50 would be good for a year (not true price doesn’t expire), install takes 2-6 hours (not true just plug into an outlet), couldn’t give me a quote (which I asked for to decide what service I wanted - asked several times) I needed to get a credit check and set up an install date before she could answer my inquiry and I needed an order #1015854215. Assured me I could request a waiver of install price by calling 1-888-285-8512 (they couldn’t help me I needed to call customer service (800-937-8997 spoke with Roxanne who finally gave me T-Mobile #800-937-8997) where I learned all the misquote info I was given.  Just to get a quote I was given a heavy sales pitch and spoke with Sonny who cancelled the order - they do not have any closure numbers for my record to assure I’m not charged. A few hours later I received an e-mail thanking me for the order with a customer #286905803. Wasn’t this cancelled?  No contact info to check so I called 844-451-2720, I spoke with 3 people the first 2 said they couldn’t help and hung up. The third one checked and told me it showed up cancelled. I plan on sharing my experience with anyone that will listen. This took an entire morning with a lot of unnecessary stress. Stay away from Allconnect!

Review.Titre: Used deception and unauthorized transfer of my personal information.
Review.Contenu: I was transferred to "someone to confirm and verify your information" but was in fact transferred to hear an attempt by this third party marketing company to hook me up with deals (already available directly online). They made it seem like this was a necessary step for verification and required for my hookup to go through in what seems to be an attempt to keep me on the line. The sales person hounded me with questions about my needs and pushed projects ignoring questions about why we are even talking about internet and ignoring my polite assertion that I was only interested in completing the power hookup and not at all interested in any other non-Duke services at this time. This is incredibly shady. I did not consent to giving this company my personal information and was told again by the agent that this was a part of the Duke process to complete my energy hook up, in an apparent attempt to keep me on the line to sell me internet and other services. I'm investigating this and trying to determine the legality of everything that happened here.

Review.Titre: Lol... puh-lease.
Review.Contenu: I was directly transferred to AllConnect by my electric company AEP Ohio after I set up electric service for our new home. At first, the AllConnect agent claimed he was only verifying my information on behalf of AEP Ohio to make sure my name was spelled correctly and so on. Soon after he verified my information that AEP sent to them (more like sold to them...), he tried to sell me other services unrelated to electric services. For example, he wanted to sell me discounted internet, all the while claiming he wasn’t selling anything at all. And then he said he would spam my email account with information on how to setup mail forwarding with USPS. Without first explaining to me what AllConnect even is, why I need them, what my obligation (if any) to AllConnect is, or any other basic information about the company, he made it sound as if he was now the curator of my relocation to a new home. At no point did he ask for my consent. Quite the opposite. I kept questioning their business model (e.g., middleman? reseller? kickbacks? ), but he pushed back against this kind of questioning and insinuated that I was being rude for daring to interrupt his substantive sales pitching with my more fundamental “who even are you” line of questioning. Ultimately, this guy actually hung up on me. I called AEP to provide feedback that this so-called “partnership” is absolutely ill-advised and that AEP should somehow track down the AllConnect agent I spoke with and also obtain the call recording to study it. My feedback was well-received by AEP. Oh and I also informed AEP that I suspect AllConnect of having predominantly fake reviews on TrustPilot. Many reviews have all of the hallmarks of fakeness, e.g., scripted sounding language that sounds more like an ad than a real consumer experience, intentional syntax/grammar mistakes to look authentic, bland one-sentence reviews left by TrustPilot accounts that only have 1 total review (presumably to raise the overall star rating), etc. There is absolutely no way that a legitimate consumer would leave these guys anything more than 0 reviews. Also, given the utterly useless business model they have, I find it ridiculous that they have more than 1300 ratings.

Review.Titre: Bad service
Review.Contenu: Bad service. June 15 called to set up internet and tv. After 45 minutes on the phone I thought I had att direct tv and optimum internet. I did get a em from att about confirming my em. I also received a em from all connect asking me to sign up for YouTube tv ( never heard about it). The cs rep did tell me I would get a em to set up my tv package do I went ahead and did it. I tried to set up my direct tv account for auto payments but I could not get in. I called att direct tv and they said I didn’t have an account. So today June 16th I spoke with All connect again. Spoke with a very nice rep, Sofie. She apologized and said I did not have direct tv, I was signed up for YouTube tv. She also advised I did have optimum internet, confirmed my tech appointment for Sunday and gave me the customer service number for optimum. I had written a prior review but don’t see it here. So in my prior review I spoke too soon about Sofie.  I called optimum and they had no record of my account. So I set up my account and saved $100 by not having a tech come to install the equipment. Sofie also confirmed my service appointment on June 18th. I hope no one shows. I put my credit on lock down because I think this organization is scamming some how. Call the companies themselves. This “SERVICE” is nothing to rave about or trust

Review.Titre: I was transferred to this company by…
Review.Contenu: I was transferred to this company by Xcel energy to supposedly finish setting up my account. I moved into a new place and was just getting the account into my name. It was not clear to me that this was a separate company from Xcel. It turned in to a "hard sell" sales pitch for internet service. After a 45 minute phone call it turned out that their "great deal" was the same price as service offered on the front page of the ISPs website and I'm wondering why Xcel is trying to sell me internet service? I kept asking if my account was set up without getting a real response. I had to call Xcel back today to get actual useful information like my account number and how to access online billing and that my account was actually set up at all.Speaking of phone calls, this lovely company decided to sell my number to every spammer on the planet. I typically get a spam call or two a week but in the last day since I had the misfortune of speaking with allconnect I have received over a dozen. Can't make this up, as I'm writing this I'm getting another spam call.I will say I do not blame the representative I was talking to as I think it's just a crappy gig and she was attempting to be friendly and helpful. In terms of choosing an ISP, they are de facto monopolies or duopolies in most areas so I really don't see why this company even exists.I have a big problem with this company as well as Xcel who dumped me onto them. They now have my name, address, phone number, SSN, and email and apparently are more then willing to drown me in spam. I filed a complaint with Xcel and I sent an email complaint to allconnect today.

Review.Titre: Nothing went wrong but...
Review.Contenu: Nothing went wrong. The name "Allconnect" is simply a misnomer. When I set up my account with VA Domion Power I was told about Allconnect and what a great service it was. That came after I had already set up my Washington Gas account. I let them transfer me to allconnect anyway and spent an hour on the phone with a representative who was friendly, willing, and apparently willing to accommodate any and all of my wishes regarding internet and TV. I told her what I was looking for she told me I got it all. The only thing lacking was any confirmation in writing showing what we had agreed upon. Since we weren't moving for a few weeks, and she assured me nothing was due until the date set, I figured nothing could go wrong.Well, instead of the EarthLink device being delivered "a few days prior to activation" it arrived a solid 7 weeks early while I was in Texas.  Fortunately I was having some work done at the house so the workers took the router inside.When I got to Virginia I discovered I had EarthLink for internet but no TV contract. I contacted Allconnect. There was no record of a previous conversation or anything. I started anew with this representative,  Jenny  (I think). After almost an hour and a half we concluded the conversation. I got most of what I wanted. I made a couple of errors in listing  the channels we wanted, and a couple were omitted because Jenny didn't listen. Unfortunately,  it is your policy -apparently- to confirm only after commitment to the service so we only found out after the fact. When I asked my wife if we should call back and change or cancel she said we should stay with what we had as my wife didn't have the energy to go through this again. Nonetheless, the whole ordeal was less than satisfying. Jenny read the disclaimers and disclosures so fast that I ( and I presume anybody) would have only gotten 10% of what she read to me. The fact that I received an email with the same disclosures/disclaimers that I could read "at my leisure" didn't help. Only after requesting clarification on the statement "there is no contract" did we find out that what we presumed to be month-to-month was, in all actuality, a binding 24 month commitment that if canceled prior to the end of the 24 month period would in fact incur a $20/month early cancelation charge. That sounds like a contract to us.I understand that a salesperson is supposed to sell things but having been on the after sales side in various companies in service departments for over 35 years,  I can vouch for the fact that many customers become ex-customers because the company and service departments will not or cannot keep promises made by the sales departments

Apparently the old owners disconnect order took a while and it held up my new install. This was never communicated to me and when I tried to reach someone, I had sub par internet chat support only.

I tried to call customer service to review my order. However the recording did not answer any thing that I tried. I pushed the 2 for recent orders and got "I'm sorry I didn't get that." Then I tried 4 for all issues and got the same reply. I did this repeatedly, I am certainly not reassued by their service and would suggest that they need to contact me.

Review.Titre: Friendly and patient, however....
Review.Contenu: The salesperson was friendly, and patient - really good qualities. However I had a hard time understanding him (partly thick accent, but mostly unclear annunciation). I'm giving this 3 stars instead of 4 because I was told there would be an HBOmax subscription plus an Amazon $200 gift card as new customer signup gifts. I still have not seen anything about either in my email or texts yet - so I think that he may have screwed up the process and neither item went through into my account. Bummer.

Review.Titre: The handoff from Allconnect to the…
Review.Contenu: The handoff from Allconnect to the provider was obscure and not handled with any information explaining what was to be expected and from who! Until a provider contacted me on the phone I thought I was still working with Allconnect with the transaction.

Review.Titre: The process could have been better
Review.Contenu: The person that helped me had a bid of an accent barrier for me.  There was a lot of information he had to read over the phone, which made it difficult to follow.  When I asked what I will be paying after the introductory 6 month period he did not answer me.

Review.Titre: Rating Okay
Review.Contenu: This experience was okay.  I just thought that the representative was rushing me through the process and could have been a little more informative about this internet process.  This is my first time getting internet and really needed to understand what was needed to get this service and the best plan for my needs.

Review.Titre: Bad Information
Review.Contenu: I was told by a rep that HughesNet was the only internet provider in my area.  I said I wanted to check myself and he agreed that I could, but suggested that I should still sign up for HughesNet while I had him on the phone because he was certain they were my only option.  So I did.  And then I saw all the negative reviews about Allconnect.com and got scared.  A quick search found that Spectrum also serviced our area for about the same price but roughly 4 times the speed.  So instead of saving me time I wasted time cancelling my HughesNet set up.  I don't necessarily think I was intentionally lied to, but regardless of the intentions the rep I talked to didn't have good information.  We'll see if I get spammed with emails or phone calls with offers but so far I haven't been.

Review.Titre: Being new to the area and not aware of…
Review.Contenu: Being new to the area and not aware of services, I relied on Allconnect.  They set me up with Spectrum for cable tv, internet and house phone.  The next day Spectrum contacted me to tell me that they do not service my area of South Carolina.I needed other services as well, but they failed to sign me up for water service or natural gas service.  I am trying to do it on my own and finding it somewhat difficult to complete.I wish Allconnect gave a more in depth service.

Review.Titre: I talked to 6 people & didn't get my…
Review.Contenu: I talked to 6 people & didn't get my questions answered. They'd transfer me because they couldnt. 1 1/2 hours on the phone & got to nowhere. They didn't find my name , I.d. or confirmation number to help me, even though I read it to them from my email. I haven't heard from them to finish things up yet. Lots of background noise & my voice echoing over theirs. They were very impatient & rude.

Review.Titre: The representative kept contradicting…
Review.Contenu: The representative kept contradicting himself.  Telling me that I would be guaranteed a flat rate for 12 months and right after making that statement he said that if fee's went up or equipment fee's went up, my bill would go up to.  I then told him that if the price of anything went up they would be breaking the contract and I would no longer have to keep the service.

Review.Titre: Changes to sign-up process sorely needed
Review.Contenu: Representative I spoke to on the phone was nice enough, but the sign-up process in general was a beat-down.  That may be out of Allconnect’s control, as I think all satellite tv and internet service providers are similar, but it sure makes for an unenjoyable experience.  The legal disclaimers basically put all the risk and responsibility on the consumer, and none on the provider.  If the service they offer/provide is so good, wouldn’t they WANT to stand behind it?  Just my two cents…

Until Monday May 24. Then the tribunicias came and started that more needs to be done. Rewire outside to be able to have the service and now I’m not even sure when I will have cable + internet. The provider to contact me back and reschedule installation until then will know more.

When i spoke with your associate, he started the price at forty-nine dollars and ninety nine cents and on top of that he got me ten more dollars off the total. He was very informative and very patient. I wish i knew his name but i do have an order number, so maybe you can identify him this way. Order number is 27679937. I don't normal respond to review requests but for this instance I am more than happy to leave a positive review.

Review.Titre: The representative was great
Review.Contenu: The representative was great. Friendly, knowledgeable, easy to understand. Unfortunately, she was mistaken about the service I was to receive. I asked specifically if their was a data cap with a cutoff and she said yes but no cutoff. Just a throttle down to 25 Mbps. That was not accurate. It is a throttle down to less than 1 Mbps and then a complete cutoff after 110% of your data package has been reached. I based my decision to buy this on that and am very put out because I'm out at least $80 and more likely $160 bucks.
